name: Google+ Interactive Posts
author: Dejan SEO

sections.description: Interactive posts are one of the greatest features within Google+, but rarely utilised due to implementation complexity. The aim of this plugin is to help webmasters take the first steps towards implementation of interactive posts. For more information, examples, installation instructions and configuration visit: http://dejanseo.com.au/wordpress-plugin-google-interactive-posts/
sections.faq:
What does this plugin do?

It enables interactive sharing on Google+ from your posts by adding call to action buttons to shared posts.

Is this plugin related to Google+ commenting?

No.

Why doesn’t this plugin do anything when I install it?

Further configuration is required to get everything going. Please read and follow the instructions available from the plugin page or visit http://dejanseo.com.au/wordpress-plugin-google-interactive-posts/ for details.

short_description: Enable Google+ interactive posts on your website in a few simple steps.
description: Interactive posts are one of the greatest features within Google+, but rarely utilised due to implementation complexity. The aim of this plugin is to help webmasters take the first steps towards implementation of interactive posts. For more information, examples, installation instructions and configuration visit: http://dejanseo.com.au/wordpress-plugin-google-interactive-posts/

screenshots.caption: This is how an interactive post looks like. In addition to a call-to-action button, your Google+ page will also collect valuable statistics (also shown in the image).

The anatomy of an Interactive Google+ Post: Prefill text will be the default text for the shared post (can be left blank); Button label type defines the button type for shared posts; Label text allows you to customise action button text; Show Google Interactive Posts Button gives you the ability to enable or disable the feature for each individual post.
You will be able to enable, disable and customise the interactive post feature on each page through a designated plugin panel.
